Description:
Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Contracts Officer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency, operating satellites that monitor the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
It’s an exciting time to be working at EUMETSAT. As an organisation we’re operating a fleet of satellites delivering weather and climate-related satellite data and images to our users worldwide; helping protect lives, property and industries. However, you don’t need to be an engineer or a scientist to make a positive contribution. Our specialist administrative and support functions play an equally important role in the success of the EUMESAT programmes and are valued members of the EUMETSAT family.
The Contracts Division provides contractual and commercial expertise across the organisation and ensures that best value for money is achieved by an efficient procurement process. The Division provides contractual and commercial expertise to the organisation, performs checks and balances to ensure compliance with the procurement rules, and ensures that procurements are timely and well managed.

Description:
Cambi has developed our own tool to help our customers achieve high process performance and smooth operation of all our Thermal Hydrolysis Plant (THP) installations and ancillaries. We call this tool PLUS - an online platform for process monitoring, analysis and support.
We are now seeking to strengthen our PLUS team with a highly skilled Data Engineer. As a successful candidate, you will play a key role in the further development and deployment of PLUS across our plants worldwide. This is a unique opportunity to get involved at an early stage and be a key player in developing one of the company’s main strategic activities.
As a PLUS Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining data streaming solutions from our industrial automation systems. Your key responsibilities will include setting up data pipelines from the plant floor to the end-user, ensuring that real-time data is continuously updated and available for analysis. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to be involved in this data analysis. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of experts to design and implement scalable, efficient, and reliable data streaming pipelines. You will also integrate new data sources, troubleshoot and debug streaming issues, and ensure data quality and integrity. Furthermore, you will play a significant role in implementing best practices for data management, data security, and data privacy.

Job_title: Sommerjobb for data scientists / data engineers — Oslo
Description:
En relevant sommerjobb er gull verdt for deg som ønsker erfaring og muligheten til å sette teori i praksis. Jobb med erfarne Bekk-konsulenter på aktuelle oppdrag, lær masse og vis oss hva du kan – og kanskje leder det til en jobb etter studiene! Sommerjobb i 2023 er fra 13. juni til 28. juli.
Hvem er du?
Du studerer datateknikk, informatikk, kybernetikk, matematikk, eller du har en annen relevant utdannelse. Du har et ønske om å få erfaring som data scientist eller data engineer, og interessen for å løse problemer med data bør være en drivkraft for deg.
Hva skal du gjøre?

Description:

Description:
Surplusmap is a VC-funded startup building the tools for the green transition. We're backed by Simula innovation - one of the top R&D companies in Norway, have gone through Google Sustainability incubator and have been invited to be part of European Space Agency Business Incubator (ESA-BIC).
We're on a mission to help companies in a green transition by making data-driven decisions on building new green industrial projects.
We're a fully remote team working across three countries for now. You'll be joining a senior team with scale-up experience and backgrounds in climate change & mapping science, Earth Observation Technologies, green finance, and tech expertise.

Vi er Sørlandets ledende fagmiljø innenfor digitalisering og teknologi.
Sammen utvider vi horisonten for hvordan teknologi og data kan bidra til at virksomheter lykkes!
Ønsker du å gjøre verdi ut av data?
Fagområdet Data & Analyse er i sterk vekst hos oss i Egde og vi ønsker flere kolleger som vil være med på å skape innsikt gjennom data. Vi arbeider med en rekke kunder i både offentlig og privat sektor, så hos oss vil du kunne få et bredt utvalg av relevante oppgaver og hele tiden kunne utvikle og oppdatere deg på den nyeste teknologien.
Vi i faggruppen er en gjeng med kompetanse innen alt fra tradisjonelle datavarehus til det nyeste innen big data og maskinlæring. Vi ønsker selvfølgelig at du kan alt innen området, men med så mye spennende å fordype seg i skjønner vi det kan være vanskelig.

Description:
ABOUT CBRE DATA CENTER SOLUTIONS
CBRE Data Centre Solutions (DCS) is a part of the CBRE Group with over 115.000 employees worldwide and delivers fully integrated real estate, facilities and technology solutions for data centre owners, occupiers and investors across the globe. As a dedicated business line within CBRE, DCS is dedicated to solving complex challenges within every stage of the data centre lifecycle.
Green Mountain has exclusively partnered with CBRE to staff our new data center site in Hamar. We need numerous positions within Operations to support what will become Norway’s largest data center. The data center will be your permanent workplace where you also will enroll in our joint training and development program. Description:
CLOSING DATE 19 APRIL 2023.
MDTotco is a business group within the Wellbore Technologies segment, and with our Downhole Broadband Solutions and Real-Time Services we are focusing on drilling automation & optimization by use of downhole data. Our department concentrates primarily on deployment of wired drill pipe (WDP) technology and along-string measurement (ASM) tools in drilling operations. The system allows transmission of real-time, high-density, low-latency data from logging-while-drilling (LWD) tools and from ASM subs. These tools provided temperature, annular/internal pressure, rotation, and vibration data.
Due to increasing demand for our products and services we are need of additional personnel in our operations group to deliver intelligent, smarter and more cost-efficient solutions to our customers.

Job_title: Senior Engineer for our global frontend engineering team at the HISP Centre.
Description:
About the position

A full time, permanent positions as Senior Engineer for our global frontend engineering team at the HISP Centre is available.
Preferred start date no later than August 15, 2023.

HISP is a global action research project considered as one of the University of Oslo's greatest international successes. HISP has developed the DHIS2 software - an IT system for collecting, validating, analyzing and presenting data for health information management activities.

We are a well-funded not-for-profit project tasked with building the open-source DHIS2 platform, the world’s most widely-deployed health information system. The project is based at the HISP Centre at the University of Oslo (UiO).

With us you get a chance to work on problems which really matter: Improving the health and well-being of people around the world through access and use of information. Our platform is used in more than 90 countries worldwide and has the scale and adoption, which will allow you to make an impact globally.

We give you a lot of flexibility and freedom and there is no micro-management or strict hierarchies. At DHIS2 we believe you will do your best work if you fully understand the context in which the system operates. As a result you are en-couraged to engage directly with our projects, take part in the design process and get feedback from users in the field.

Knowledge development in a changing world - Science and technology towards 2030
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t4wvWQEhDEs

Jarli og Jordan/UiO
About this role

DHIS2 software engineers develop a platform used to improve health care at a global scale. We work directly with end-users in order to understand how our system is being used. DHIS2 developers work in small teams and have significant impact on the product. We are seeking software engineers who are passionate about developing elegant, high-performance web applications.

At HISP you will be part of the software design process and have great influence on the end product. We give you the vision and the challenge — you have the freedom to choose your own approach to problem solving. And of course, you can pick your hardware, tools and IDE. Our front-end is built with modern frameworks including React and Redux, and we maintain a powerful developer toolchain (called the application platform) which is used both internally and externally by DHIS2 application developers.

DHIS2 has been built API-first with an extensible app architecture. We continuously deliver our applications and have short, iterative development cycles. You can find our source code on GitHub. Check out the backend repository and a typical front-end app repository. We also support a developer community building on top of the DHIS2 platform.

What You'll Do

At HISP you will specialize in building software features for the DHIS2 open-source platform. You will work on features related to analytics, information retrieval, metadata management, offline data collection and data synchronization. The role requires a passion and ability for finding innovative engineering solutions to complex problems.

Qualification requirements


Relevant master degree or above in Computer Science (from college or university). Relevant experience can weigh up for lack of formal education.
3-5+ years of experience building rich, performant, and scalable web applications.
Fluent in verbal and written English
Strong skills in clear technical writing and communication
Expert knowledge of Javascript
Expert knowledge of web technologies (HTML/CSS).
Strong experience with and deep understanding of React or similar frameworks
Strong experience working with REST Web APIs and JSON


Knowledge of DHIS2 software is an advantage
Experience building technology for use in low-resource settings is a plus
Experience in public health and international development is a plus, but not required
Personal skills
Passionate about working on a meaningful, impactful, and challenging global project
Committed, independent, reliable and structured person who, in collaboration with other colleagues, focuses on contributing to good solutions

Emphasis will be placed on the applicant's professional and personal suitability with a focus on:

Systematic approach
Analysis and assessment
Implementation
Self-development
Initiative and responsibility
Flexible
We offer
Salary NOK 701 300 - 814 900 per year depending on qualifications in posi-tion as Senior Engineer (position code 1181)
A professionally stimulating working environment
Attractive welfare benefits and a generous pension agreement, in addition to Oslo’s family-friendly environment with its rich opportunities for culture and outdoor activities
How to apply


Cover letter
CV (complete overview of education and work experience)
Copies of educational certificates, transcripts of records and letters of recommendation
Name and contact details of 2-3 references (name, relation to candidate, e-mail and phone number)

The application with attachments must be delivered in our electronic recruiting system, please follow the link “apply for this job”.

Foreign applicants are advised to attach an explanation of their University's grading system. Please note that all documents should be in English (or a Scandinavian language).

Formal regulations

Interviews with the best qualified candidates will be arranged.

According to the Norwegian Freedom of Information Act (Offentleglova) information about the applicant may be included in the public applicant list, also in cases where the applicant has requested non-disclosure.

Inclusion and diversity are a strength. The University of Oslo has a personnel policy objective of achieving a balanced gender composition.Furthermore, we want employees with diverse professional expertise, life experience and perspectives.

If there are qualified applicants with disabilities, employment gaps or immigrant background, we will invite at least one applicant from each of these categories to an interview.

Contact information

austin@dhis2.org or Stian M. V. Sandvold, phone +47 91382683, email: stianmsa@ifi.uio.no

For questions regarding the recruitment system, please contact HR Adviser Therese Ringvold, email : therese.ringvold@mn.uio.no

About the University of Oslo

The University of Oslo is Norway’s oldest and highest rated institution of research and education with 28 000 students and 7000 employees. Its broad range of academic disciplines and internationally esteemed research communities make UiO an important contributor to society.

The Department of Informatics (IFI) is one of nine departments belonging to the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences. IFI is Norway’s largest university department for general education and research in Computer Science and related topics.

The Department has more than 1800 students on bachelor level, 600 master students, and over 240 PhDs and postdocs. The overall staff of the Department is close to 370 employees, about 280 of these in full time positions. The full time tenured academic staff is 75, mostly Full/Associate Professors.

Description:
Responsibilities
You will be joining the Data & Analytics team, which is a part of the global Product & Tech located in Oslo and Copenhagen. The team is responsible for all data engineering, BI reporting, and machine learning projects to enable data-driven decision making for internal business leads as well as for external partners such as banks, insurance companies and affiliates. Data is a key priority for our business and we're moving fast to unlock its full potential.
At the moment, we are several dedicated data professionals. Our responsibilities cover the full scope of project delivery; with a starting point in stakeholder needs and desires, we set up and maintain the data lake, build ETL/ELT pipelines and design final solutions. We are operating on a modern cloud-based data architecture powered by AWS Redshift and Microsoft Power BI. The complete system landscape includes a new event-based platform architecture, legacy MySQL databases, marketing and advertising platforms and CRM and CMS solutions.
In your new role as a Data Engineer with Axo Group, you will take ownership and governance of all data flows between various systems to ensure quality, reliability and performance. An important part of the job is the management of the master data model in Power BI that enables all our standard business reporting. This work includes data transformations in the data lake (SQL) and data modelling in Power BI (DAX).

Description:
TracSense is looking for a knowledgeable Software Engineer to help us develop our sensor and software system. This is an interesting position within a growing, multi-disciplinary team. Press the expand button for more info.
LOCATION: OSLO, NORWAY
QUALIFICATION: GRADUATION
MORE DETAILS
JOB DESCRIPTION
TracSense is an Oslo-based tech startup that is developing exciting new technology for next-generation cars. The friction between the tires and asphalt are an important parameter in safe operations, especially in cold climates. By applying sophisticated Machine Learning algorithms TracSense wants to bring friction intelligence to all cars on the road. To aid in the development of one of our sensor systems we are looking for a talented ML / Software engineer. Currently we have a full-time position available in our office in Oslo.

Description:
Job description

The University of Oslo is looking for a Data Scientist with expertise in biodiversity informatics for the HORIZON-INFRA-2021-TECH-01 project "Biodiversity Digital Twin for Advanced Modeling, Simulation, and Prediction Capabilities" (BioDT). The BioDT project is a 36-month (2022-2025) pan-European research infrastructure project coordinated by the CSC IT Center for Science (Espoo, Finland) and includes 22 project partners from across 12 countries.

More about the position

The appointment is a full-time project position until the end of the project in May 2025. The position will be associated with the Norwegian Participant Node (GBIF Norway) of the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) and based at the University of Oslo Natural History Museum in Oslo. The appointed candidate will take part in a multinational team for delivering the responsibilities of UiO for the Horizon Europe-funded Biodiversity Twin (BioDT) project and be responsible for working with biodiversity information standards for the content data streams in collaboration with project partners and international standards bodies. BioDT’s objective is to create a first-in-class digital twin prototype for the advanced modeling and prediction of biodiversity and its patterns. Through practical user cases, it will address critical issues related to global biodiversity dynamics, and support science-based decision-making for the protection and restoration of our earth’s biodiversity.


Capture requirements and coordinate collaboration on data standards from across the research infrastructures (RIs) of GBIF, Distributed System of Scientific Collections (DiSSCo ESFRI), Long-Term Ecosystem Research in Europe (eLTER ESFRI), and the LifeWatch ERIC.
Documenting and communicating data content and data quality requirements, and addressing issues diagnosed in relation to the data standards for ecological data and other data types for the BioDT use cases.
Contribute to the implementation of processes and data flows from environmental databases to ecological models, including data quality and fitness for use checks.
Disseminating captured project requirements and results from the improvement of the data standards at relevant conferences and in peer-reviewed scientific journals.
Interact with task groups of the Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG) community and other relevant stakeholders involved in the development of the biodiversity information standards and vocabularies for the data streams to the BioDT use cases.
Collaborating with other project team members at the GBIF Secretariat to mobilize new data resources through interactions with the biological community. Supporting data publishers, and data users with data standards-related questions.
Supporting the wider network of project partners and collaborators through technical support and training, including a strong communication component (email, video calls, etc.).
Qualification requirements
A Ph.D. or an equivalent doctoral degree in data science, biodiversity informatics, ecoinformatics, natural sciences, or a related field.
Experience with biodiversity informatics, data science, FAIR data principles, open science, persistent identifier technologies, and open data stewardship.
A relevant scientific publication record.
Excellent English language skills (written and spoken).
Desired qualifications and personal qualities
Experience with relevant biodiversity data standards such as Darwin Core, Ecological Metadata Standards (EML), Biological Collections Ontology (BCO), Environment Ontology (EnvO), and/or Minimum Information about any (x) Sequence (MIxS).
Knowledge of the research infrastructures for biodiversity data, including the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF), Long-Term Ecosystem Research in Europe (eLTER), Distributed System of Scientific Collections (DiSSCo), and the LifeWatch ERIC e-Science European infrastructure for biodiversity and ecosystem research.
Experience with relevant data types including species occurrence data, collection specimens, taxonomic data, ecoinformatics, and ecological data.
Teaching experience within data science and/or biodiversity informatics.
Experience with suitable programming languages for data flow and analysis.
Experience with collaboration tools like Git (GitHub) and related solutions.
Demonstrated ability to communicate and work in a distributed team.
Experience with teamwork in an international and multicultural setting.
Scandinavian language skills are an advantage.
We offer
Salary NOK 661 400 - 746 900 per annum depending on qualifications (position code Researcher SKO 1109).
A chance to contribute to building a world-class research infrastructure that is central to the European strategic plans for research, digitization, and the green new deal.
Career building links with a vibrant international research network with excellent opportunities for building a career in data science.
A stimulating and friendly working environment.
Membership in the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund.
Attractive welfare benefits and a generous pension agreement, in addition to Oslo’s family-friendly environment with its rich opportunities for culture and outdoor activities.
How to apply

The application must include

A cover letter that includes a statement of motivation and a summary of scientific background and research interests.
A CV summarizing education, positions, research profile and merits, pedagogical qualifications, and other qualifying activities.
A list of scientific publications.
Contact information for two reference persons (name, relation to candidate, e-mail, and phone number). No reference letters should be submitted.
The application with attachments must be delivered in our electronic recruiting system.
Please note that all documents should be in English. Interviews will be part of the appointment process.
Formal regulations

According to the Norwegian Freedom of Information Act (Offentleglova) information about the applicant may be included in the public applicant list, also in cases where the applicant has requested non-disclosure.

Inclusion and diversity are a strength. The University of Oslo has a personnel policy objective of achieving a balanced gender composition. Furthermore, we want employees with diverse professional expertise, life experience and perspectives.

If there are qualified applicants with disabilities, employment gaps or immigrant background, we will invite at least one applicant from each of these categories to an interview.

Contact information

Chief engineer Dag Endresen, dag.endresen@nhm.uio.no, +47 40612982, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2352-5497

Research Director Hugo de Boer, h.de.boer@nhm.uio.no, +47 98126030, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1985-7859

For questions about the recruitment system, please contact HR Officer Thomas Brånå: thomas.brana@nhm.uio.no

About the University of Oslo

The University of Oslo (UiO, https://ror.org/01xtthb56) is Norway’s oldest and highest ranked educational and research institution, with 28 000 students and 7000 employees. With its broad range of academic disciplines and internationally recognised research communities, UiO is an important contributor to society.

The Natural History Museum (UiO-NHMO) has about 200 employees organized into five sections. The section for research and collections has about 97 employees, is organized into nine research groups, and conducts research in biodiversity and evolution. The research covers both biology and geology (incl. paleontology), and the scientific staff is responsible for managing and developing the largest scientific collection in Norway (approx. six million objects). NHM's scientific staff also contributes by teaching and supervising students admitted to various programs at the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences and disseminates research-based knowledge to the public through exhibitions, lectures, and popular science media.

The Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF, https://ror.org/05fjyn938) is an international network and data infrastructure funded by the world’s governments and aimed at providing anyone, anywhere, free and open access to data about all types of life on Earth. The Norwegian Participant node in GBIF (www.gbif.no) is hosted at the UiO-NHMO.

Description:
Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Description:
Gjennom utvikling av nye, datadrevne løsninger ønsker våre kunder å hente ut mer verdi av egne og andres data på en trygg og effektiv måte. Stikkord er god og sikker informasjonsforvaltning med fokus på fangst, lagring, foredling, bruk og formidling av data og innsikt.
Brenner du for utnyttelse av data og ønsker å være med å bygge vår avdeling og satsning på dataplattform og -analyse? Da bør du lese videre!


Hos oss får du:

Med utgangspunkt i kundens behov vil du jobbe med design og implementering av sikre, datadrevne løsninger i ulike konfigurasjoner av skyoppsett (on-prem, private, community, public, hybrid, multicloud). Du vil være den kunnskapsrike navigatøren som loser kunden trygt gjennom reisen.

Vil du jobbe med noe som skaper verdi for samfunnet?
Handelshøyskolen BI bruker store ressurser på å skape fremragende digitale brukeropplevelser og har høye ambisjoner for digitalisering både i undervisning og av virksomhetsprosesser. Sammen med ca 65 dyktige kollegaer jobber vi med å forme morgendagens tech-tilbud til studentene våre, i tett samarbeid med flere av Norges største konsulentfirmaer. Produktene vi lager, og verktøyene vi jobber med blir brukt av over 20.000 studenter. Stor påvirkningskraft og endringsvilje er nøkkelord på vår arbeidsplass. Vi vil ha fornøyde ansatte, og tilbyr derfor en fleksibel og familievennlig arbeidshverdag med mulighet for gratis videreutdanning.
Vi søker deg som ønsker å ha faglig ledese av BIs tekniske Analytics-team.
Hva går jobben ut på?

Description:
Shaping the future of shipping and logistics
We are on a quest to build resilient, decarbonized, and cost-effective supply chains, and are now seeking a Data Engineer to join our Supply Chain Analytics (SCA) team. The team works closely with customers of CargoValue to increase visibility of their supply chain data and provide them with actionable insights to significantly improve their supply chain management.
Together we want to have a positive impact on the world we live in, helping global companies reduce costs, risks and CO2 emissions related to their shipping activities.
Who are we
Klaveness Digital is a Norwegian technology company on a mission to bring shipping and logistics into the future through our SaaS solution, CargoValue. CargoValue is a cloud-based platform that provides industrial companies with a digital twin of their seaborne supply chains, improving supply chain management by delivering real-time visibility, improving transparency, and fostering collaboration between stakeholders involved in the planning, scheduling, and production processes.

Description:
Company Description

Silva Green Fuel works at the forefront of the green shift and uses a world-leading technology for the production of second-generation biofuel. The demonstration plant for the verification of the technology was completed in 2021 and is the first of its kind in the world. We are now preparing for establishing a full-scale commercial facility that can help reduce carbon emissions from the transport sector by 250000 – 375000 tonnes of CO2 annually.
Silva Green Fuel was established by Statkraft and Södra in 2015. Through the collaboration, Statkraft's broad expertise in renewable energy is combined with Södra's experience in forest-based bioenergy.

Description:
Overview:
Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.

New opportunity for a Field Service Engineer to install and support high technology equipment in research, pharmaceutical, university and government labs for Bruker BioSpin, a leading manufacturer of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and compact magnetic resonance (CMR) spectroscopy instruments and accessories. The Field Service Engineer works with highly complex equipment that requires advanced understanding of these instruments to perform installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair service activities.

Description:
We are looking for a Lifecycle Engineer – Offshore Handling Systems to join our team in Kongsberg Maritime. Your main responsibility will be to develop and communicate lifecycle and maintenance strategies for our products.

As our Lifecycle Engineer, you work cross functional with our technical departments, service engineers and sales team. Through analysis of failure modes and operational data, you will develop maintenance strategies for our products and associated spare part kits. You will provide maintenance instructions which helps our customers maintain low lifecycle costs and secure high availability of their assets. Methods such as FMECA and RAM analysis will be core to the work.
With us, you will join an international organization characterized by a professional environment, both for knowledge sharing and development. In this role, you should thrive as part of a team, but also deliver independently on assigned tasks. You need to be comfortable taking responsibility, while maintaining a positive and solution-oriented attitude.

: The Azure Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining scalable and efficient data solutions for clients using Azure DataBricks and DataWarehouse. Collaborate with clients to understand their data requirements and design and implement data solutions to meet their needs.
Build and maintain ETL pipelines to extract, transform, and load data into DataBricks and DataWarehouse.
Develop and maintain data models and architecture to ensure scalability, performance, and security of the data.

Requirements:


If you are an experienced Azure Data Engineer with a focus on DataBricks and DataWarehouse and are looking to join a dynamic and growing team in Oslo, Norway, please apply with your updated resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and skills.

ONNEC Group are a leading independent technology partner and global integrator, with over 30 years experience, and a 800+ team of global experts, specialising in providing end-to-end connectivity solutions that propel organisations everywhere.
We are a rapidly growing organisation and finding and retaining the highest calibre of people is fundamental to us for the success of our business, we work hard to create a challenging, supportive and satisfying working environment for all our employees. Onnec Group is a leading multinational group of companies with our headquarter in London. We are active in the field of infrastructure for Telecommunications, Data Centres & smart buildings. Description:
Data/ML Engineer - 2023
Askeladden & Co har siden 2016 rullet ut en rekke suksessfulle konsepter og selskaper innenfor ulike bransjer. I dag har Askeladden over 20 selskaper i drift og har blant annet lansert nye konsepter innen legebransjen med Dr.Dropin, massasjebransjen med Squeeze og pizzabransjen med Digg Askeladden ønsker å utfordre tradisjonelle bransjen med innovative forretningsmodeller og bedre opplevelser for forbrukeren, som ofte muliggjøres av gode tekniske løsninger.
Vi søker nå etter Data/ML Engineer med oppstart 2023 ‍‍ Som Data/ML Engineer i Askeladden vil du jobbe med de nyeste teknologiene innenfor dataanalyse, data-pipelines og maskinlæring Teamet er ansvarlig for å utvikle datadrevne løsninger som vil hjelpe selskapene våre å ta de aller beste beslutningene.

Description:
Vi bistår våre kunder med å møte morgendagens utfordringer ved hjelp av kunstig intelligens og avansert analyse, slik at de kan ta proaktive beslutninger som skaper økt verdi på en effektiv og sikker måte.
Brenner du for ny teknologi, kunstig intelligens og analyse, samtidig som du trigges av å jobbe i et miljø der det verdsettes å tenke nytt? Da bør du lese videre!

Vi har en variert kundebase og vinner stadig nye kunder. Alt fra små gründerselskap til store offentlige virksomheter. Fellesnevneren er at kundene ofte har komplekse problemstillinger som krever avanserte løsninger ved hjelp av statistiske modeller, kunstig intelligens og maskinlæring.
Vi har de siste årene bygget et sterkt fagmiljø i Aztek som brenner for ende-til-ende implementasjon av maskinlæring og analyse. Dette ønsker vi å ytterligere forsterke og du vil få en sentral rolle i den videre utviklingen av avdelingen og vår satsning på dataplattform og -analyse.

Why choose Orange Business:
At Orange Business, part of the Orange group, you will become part of a team with committed colleagues who are genuinely interested in technology and its application. We are convinced that data is an exceptional but still underutilized resource. We work daily to unlock the potential of data to create positive impact.
The Professional Services department is the expert consulting team in Orange Business for Public Cloud projects, helping customers identify and realize desired cloud adoption outcomes. Joining our team means to join a respectful and safe environment, where everyone’s voice is heard and where you are encouraged to take initiative and cultivate ideas. You will get plenty opportunities to grow & develop. Whether at home or in the office, by playing together we create positive impact for our customers. Our offices are Great place to Work certified.

Description:
Everbridge: a fast-growing global provider of SaaS-based critical communications and enterprise safety solutions are currently seeking a Norwegian speaking Technical Support Engineer (TSE). This role can be office based (hybrid) in Oslo or homebased anywhere in Norway.

About Everbridge
Everbridge is the Global leader in Public Warning that automates and accelerates a government or agency’s operational response to critical events to keep people safe, assets protected and provide guidance for safety. Headquartered in the United States, with operations in Europe, India, APAC, Latin America, United Kingdom, our team of 2000+ dedicated employees support over 6000 global customers every day in their most crucial moments. During public safety threats such as Earthquakes, Tsunami’s, Floods, Fires as well as active assailant, terrorist attack or missing persons, Governments and agencies rely on our Public Warning platform to alert their citizens at risk quickly and reliably, automate the execution of pre-defined communications processes, and track progress on executing response plans.

Description:
This job will provide you with an opportunity to further your career alongside some of the best and most passionate technology experts from around the world in a leading company within the test, measurement and data analytics industry. You will be a strong contributor collaborating closely with colleagues from various business functions.
At HBK, we live up to our three values: Be True, Own It and Aim High. We believe in absolute integrity – it’s how we win for stakeholders, the environment and each other. We believe in teamwork and keeping our promises – to ourselves and others. Finally, we believe in being bold and positive. This is how we perform at our best and achieve greater success.
The position
We are currently looking for a Project Engineer for our team in Engineering Services at our HBK site based in Kolbotn, Norway, supporting on projects big and small.
Our new Project Engineer will be responsible for supporting our customers and colleagues with measurement projects in the field of mechanical quantities such as strain, torque, force, displacement, acceleration and vibration. This is the perfect role for someone who wants a 50/50 theoretical and practical job.

Description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

Description:
Special engineer
Institute for Cancer Research, Department of Tumor Biology
Apply for position
(in new tab)


About the position
A full-time position as engineer is available for 2 years at the Department of Tumor Biology, Institute of Cancer Research, Oslo University Hospital (OUS).
At Department of Tumor Biology we work to improve treatment of metastatic cancer by identifying candidate biomarkers and therapeutic targets, followed by validation in preclinical models and translation into clinical trials. The engineer will be associated with the research groups of Prof Kjersti Flatmark and Prof Gunhild Mælandsmo, and will perform experiments for both groups.

The main project will be performed in collaboration with Node Pharma, a preclinical radiopharmaceutical company developing therapies for cancer patients with limited treatment options.

Description:
Business Function Overview:
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a CO+I CE Field Services Engineer (FSE).
Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I FSE, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.
Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

Description:
Hansen Norway is hiring a DevOps Engineer
As a DevOps Engineer in the Hansen CIS-E Operations team, you are an important part of our organisation and will be working with our clients in the Nordics and highly competent colleagues around the world. The CIS-E system, used by our clients are both available on-prem at the client’s own data centre or offered as Software as a Service from Hansen in both private cloud and Azure. There are currently major changes in the energy market, and this is an exciting journey to be part of.

Description:
Are you an experienced Cloud Infrastructure Engineer that is deeply into DevOps and wants to be at the forefront of the Telco cloud evolution? Description:
Local Unit & Position Description:
DNV is a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications for the assurance industry with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets.
Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity industry data platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe, and secure way.

Veracity is DNV’s independent cloud, set out to deliver trust and scale to industry digitalization and decarbonization. It brings together all the key players in the maritime and energy industries, to drive business innovation and digital transformation over a common data truth. On Veracity Marketplace, users can further browse, purchase and access relevant industry data, applications, and digital services. Today, more than 40 000 companies and 300 000 users engage over Veracity, enjoying frictionless connection through the exchange of datasets, APIs, applications, and insights. Visit www.veracity.com to discover more.

Description:
Company Profile

Oceaneering International Inc. er en global leverandør av ingeniørtjenester og produkter, hovedsakelig til olje- og gassindustrien, og er lokalisert i alle geografiske regioner i verden. Oceaneering Norge består av selskapene Oceaneering AS, Oceaneering Asset Integrity AS og Oceaneering Rotator AS.

Description:
Om stillingen
Sopra Steria har endelig etablert seg nordpå også, nærmere bestemt i Tromsø. Ett år siden oppstart, og vi har allerede fått en god posisjon. Vi har det siste året etablert oss i Bergen, Fredrikstad, Drammen, Kristiansand og Hamar også. Vi ønsker de beste i byen til å være med på å bygge oss opp til å bli den foretrukne leverandøren av IT-tjenester og transformasjon hos kundene i Nord-Norge. Vi har et sterkt selskap i ryggen, tilgang på et ekstremt bredt spekter av kompetanse og vi kan vise til lignende suksesshistorier både i Trondheim og Stavanger, hvor vi i sistnevnte lokasjon har gått fra 0 til 200 ansatte på kun fem år!

Nå trenger vi nye kolleger som kan være med å bygge videre vårt miljø rundt Data Management i Tromsø. Har du erfaring med databaser, datavarehus, datalakes og/eller analyseverktøy - on-prem eller i sky - og ønsker å videreutvikle deg til å bli en ekspert som kan hjelpe våre kunder med å bli mer data- og analysedrevet – da er vi rett sted for deg. Hos oss vil du jobbe med svært dyktige og engasjerte kolleger i et faglig spennende og sosialt miljø. Du vil være del av et voksende fagmiljø som stadig styrker vår posisjon som eksperter på data- og analyseplattformer, datavarehus, dataflyter, transformasjon/modellering og rapportering/visualisering m.m. Vi har evner til å designe, bygge og forvalte løsninger for de mest spennende kundene i Norge, og vi utvikler og skaper innsikt innenfor både privat og offentlig sektor.


Du trigges av å skape gode kundeopplevelser, du er opptatt av å lære nye ting, og både bruke og videreformidle kunnskapen du allerede sitter på. Du er komfortabel med en hektisk arbeidshverdag og jobber godt i team, så vel som alene. Kanskje har du også en ambisjon om å bli en spydspiss innen etablering av høyt automatiserte dataplattformer som tilgjengeliggjør maskinlæring, kunstig intelligens eller analyse for alle, i en kontekst de kjenner, på et nivå de mestrer. Det som er sikkert, er at du har innsikt i hvordan dataanalyse kan skape verdi på tvers av forretningsområder. Du er metodisk, har gode analytiske ferdigheter, og du er nysgjerrig på moderne dataplattformer og fremtidsrettet teknologi.


Sopra Steria har hatt en formidabel organisk vekst på stadig flere lokasjoner i Norge, og har nå fått godt fotfeste også i Nord-Norge. Vi har det siste året etablert kontor og fått med oss veldig dyktige folk på laget. Vi har allerede blitt en god gjeng på kontoret vårt i Tromsø, hvorav 10+ tilhører fagområdene rundt Cloud, og du vil bli en del av en faglig dyktig miljø av tekniske konsulenter, samt at vi i tillegg har Norges ledende miljø innenfor Cloud nasjonalt.


Den viktigste årsaken til at du bør vurdere å søke, er muligheten til å bryne deg på og lære av et stort, morsomt og dyktig fagmiljø. Du vil også få muligheten til å jobbe for bransjens mest spennende kunder, og jobbe med et bredt spekter av prosjekter med stor samfunnsmessig betydning. Vi har naturligvis gode forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger med privat helseforsikring og du får full lønn under foreldrepermisjon. I tillegg vil du få tilgang på bedriftshytter, bidrag til medlemskap hos SATS og ikke minst en ekstra ferieuke (seks uker totalt). Dessuten har vi mange ulike aktivitetsgrupper; fotball, friluftsliv, gaming og karaoke, for å nevne noen. Men frykt ikke, deltagelse er høyst frivillig. Vi bør kanskje også nevne at vi er kåret til Norges beste arbeidsplass seks år på rad!

Har du lyst til å bli med på veksten og reisen vår fremover? Da gleder vi oss til å lese din CV og søknad. Søkere vil bli fortløpende vurdert, og vi vil også gjennomføre intervjuer fortløpende.


Ta gjerne kontakt med André Bakland eller Helene Eide dersom du har spørsmål.

Description:
Everbridge: a fast-growing global provider of SaaS-based critical communications and enterprise safety solutions are currently seeking a Norwegian speaking Technical Support Engineer (TSE). This role can be office based (hybrid) in Oslo or homebased anywhere in Norway.

About Everbridge
Everbridge is the Global leader in Public Warning that automates and accelerates a government or agency’s operational response to critical events to keep people safe, assets protected and provide guidance for safety. Headquartered in the United States, with operations in Europe, India, APAC, Latin America, United Kingdom, our team of 2000+ dedicated employees support over 6000 global customers every day in their most crucial moments. During public safety threats such as Earthquakes, Tsunami’s, Floods, Fires as well as active assailant, terrorist attack or missing persons, Governments and agencies rely on our Public Warning platform to alert their citizens at risk quickly and reliably, automate the execution of pre-defined communications processes, and track progress on executing response plans.

Description:
Business Function Overview:
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a CO+I CE Field Services Engineer (FSE).
Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I FSE, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.
Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

Description:
Aker BP’s vision is to become the leading exploration and production company within oil and gas. We plan to achieve that by producing natural resources with low emissions and costs, while at the same time creating jobs, along with values for our owners and the broader society. Measured in production, we are one of the largest independent publicly listed oil companies in Europe. We have big plans for the future, which include further growth and a desire to improve the industry.


Drilling & Wells is responsible for delivery of large project portfolio with total net resources of more than 700 million barrels of oil equivalents, and a comprehensive exploration campaign to support future organic growth. You will be reporting to D&W Manager in one of our Assets with the ambition to develop Aker BP to the next level in the driling industry and change the oil and gas industry. You will also have an active role in Aker BP’s improvement and digitalization agenda finding better and smarter ways of working.

Description:
Special engineer
Institute for Cancer Research, Department of Tumor Biology
Apply for position
(in new tab)


About the position
A full-time position as engineer is available for 2 years at the Department of Tumor Biology, Institute of Cancer Research, Oslo University Hospital (OUS).
At Department of Tumor Biology we work to improve treatment of metastatic cancer by identifying candidate biomarkers and therapeutic targets, followed by validation in preclinical models and translation into clinical trials. The engineer will be associated with the research groups of Prof Kjersti Flatmark and Prof Gunhild Mælandsmo, and will perform experiments for both groups.

The main project will be performed in collaboration with Node Pharma, a preclinical radiopharmaceutical company developing therapies for cancer patients with limited treatment options.

Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Infrastructure Engineer | SWIFT
In Mastercard we are using solutions from SWIFT, the world’s leading provider of secure financial messaging services, to provide payment information between financial institutions.

Mastercard Payment Services is certified as an official Swift Service Bureau, which enables us to act as a binding link between external customers and Swift, allowing us to increase our service-offering.

Description:
Join the SURF asset integrity team as an engineer and help our clients make better decisions. With cutting-edge methods and tools, you will monitor SURF assets, analyse data, and develop interactive dashboards on our digital platform.
Our team is working closely with clients, helping them get value from understanding data and providing them with the insight they need to keep operating their assets safely and efficiently.
You will be part of a team of highly experienced engineers who are welcoming and passionate about sharing good ideas and knowledge. Together with you, we will continue to build and create new services that are valuable to our clients and partners.
You typically have a strong background in SURF or have experience with integrity management. You also have a keen interest in being involved with creating new services and products for our clients.

Job_title: Senior Process Engineer – Cell Assembly & Formation (Norway)
Description:
Company Description

24M Technologies answers the world’s need for affordable energy storage by enabling a new, more cost-effective solution — SemiSolidTM lithium-ion technology. Our breakthrough manufacturing platform provides for low-cost, high energy density, safe and long-life storage for electric mobility, grid and other applications. Through strategic partnerships with industry leaders, including the Volkswagen Group, Kyocera, GPSC and FREYR, 24M has built an ecosystem to rapidly scale the SemiSolidTM platform and develop a better, cleaner energy future. Founded in 2010 and led by some of the battery industry’s foremost inventors, scientists and entrepreneurs, 24M is headquartered in Cambridge, Mass. and backed by top industrial partners and venture capital firms. For more information, please visit www.24-m.com.

Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
We are seeking a highly skilled Instrument Engineer to join our Maintenance, Modifications and Operations. The ideal candidate will have a professional interest in following developments in technology and improving work methods, as well as strong communication and cooperation skills. They will participate in study groups, concept development work and detail engineering, and will be responsible for specifying and preparing new and updated layouts, termination and loop designs. Additionally, they will specify, prepare data sheets, and follow-up with vendors for instrument packages, prepare job cards, and MTO for bulk and tagged items. Offshore and onshore field surveys will also be required.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Description:
Hansen Norway is hiring a DevOps Engineer
As a DevOps Engineer in the Hansen CIS-E Operations team, you are an important part of our organisation and will be working with our clients in the Nordics and highly competent colleagues around the world. The CIS-E system, used by our clients are both available on-prem at the client’s own data centre or offered as Software as a Service from Hansen in both private cloud and Azure. You will contribute to deploy and maintain the CIS-E software in test and production environments, mainly in Azure. You will also support the work to maintain and improve the build and deployment tools to support CI/CD.
There are currently major changes in the energy market, and this is an exciting journey to be part of.

Description:
Are you an experienced Cloud Infrastructure Engineer that is deeply into DevOps and wants to be at the forefront of the Telco cloud evolution? I am Thomas Mårtensson and I am leading the development and operations of Telia's network cloud platform. Right now, we are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to our NFVI-team to further increase our ability to maintain and evolve the network cloud platform.
Is this your next opportunity?
As a DevOps Engineer you will continue to evolve our network cloud platform and do this by using the latest technologies in the area. You will be part of an agile team that are responsible for Lifecycle Management (LCM), Change Management, Incident Management and automation of the infrastructure.
The team works currently according to Agile and SAFe ways-of-working and are looking to adapt SRE practices/principles going forward.

Description:
Cisco Norway is a global leader in developing video conferencing technology - helping millions of people connect and collaborate around the world. At our development center outside Oslo, we have 400 engineers working with hardware and software - from idea to design, mechanics, audio, media processing and artificial intelligence. Our solutions are used by small businesses and large corporations, universities, governments, and international organizations.

Description:
Local Unit & Position Description:
DNV is a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications for the assurance industry with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets.
Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity industry data platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe, and secure way.

Veracity is DNV’s independent cloud, set out to deliver trust and scale to industry digitalization and decarbonization. It brings together all the key players in the maritime and energy industries, to drive business innovation and digital transformation over a common data truth. On Veracity Marketplace, users can further browse, purchase and access relevant industry data, applications, and digital services. Today, more than 40 000 companies and 300 000 users engage over Veracity, enjoying frictionless connection through the exchange of datasets, APIs, applications, and insights. Visit www.veracity.com to discover more.

Company Description

24M Technologies answers the world’s need for affordable energy storage by enabling a new, more cost-effective solution — SemiSolidTM lithium-ion technology. Our breakthrough manufacturing platform provides for low-cost, high energy density, safe and long-life storage for electric mobility, grid and other applications. Through strategic partnerships with industry leaders, including the Volkswagen Group, Kyocera, GPSC and FREYR, 24M has built an ecosystem to rapidly scale the SemiSolidTM platform and develop a better, cleaner energy future. Founded in 2010 and led by some of the battery industry’s foremost inventors, scientists and entrepreneurs, 24M is headquartered in Cambridge, Mass. and backed by top industrial partners and venture capital firms. For more information, please visit www.24-m.com.

Description:
Do you want to solve global energy challenges for future generations?

At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future.
We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?
In the Method & Marine Engineering Department we are 59 people divided into two teams. The Marine team consists of 12 experienced marine and structural engineers covering marine design, structural design and analyses and marine operation for offshore and onshore installations. The team is also involved in studies and tenders. A Marine/Structural engineer at our Marine-Department it is expected to have different task in projects, such as structural calculations and analyses, design reports and marine operation manuals related to grillage design, lifting operations, load out, transport and mooring. It is expected that the engineer takes different roles in projects, such as Discipline Lead, Group Lead and Engineer, depending on the workload in the department. Our intention is to strengthen the marine discipline for participation in Aker Solutions major projects, nationally and internationally. You will be joining a dedicated team of Marine/Structural Engineers and learn our work processes as you go. Training will be given and you will receive a mentor to guide you while developing your skills. We can offer exciting and challenging tasks in a informal, dynamic and pleasant working environment. We can promise you it will be both challenging and fun to be part of our team!

Description:
Company Profile

Oceaneering International Inc. er en global leverandør av ingeniørtjenester og produkter, hovedsakelig til olje- og gassindustrien, og er lokalisert i alle geografiske regioner i verden. Oceaneering Norge består av selskapene Oceaneering AS, Oceaneering Asset Integrity AS og Oceaneering Rotator AS.
Vårt oppdrag og visjon er; Vi løser det uløselige og får fremgang ved å lage bransjeendrende teknisk kreative løsninger for de mest kompliserte operative utfordringene under vann, på land og i verdensrommet.

Description:
At Moreld Ross Offshore we understand the lifecycle of an oil field – and know exactly what you need, every step of the way. We have been in your shoes.

We live to solve difficult challenges and find the best solutions tailored for you. We help you fill the gaps – and we do it fast. Our workforce is flexible and highly adaptable. Equipped with technology that enables us to deliver quality and work efficiently regardless of location.

We are proud to be competent team players. Our workforce is hard working, highly experienced within oil services AND has guaranteed experience from the NCS. We work together, across fields to ensure your success.
Duration: 01.08.2023 - 01.08.2025


Perform completion technical engineering work in all phases of the well projects in close collaboration with asset, subsurface, projects, contractors and drilling superintendent, in order to ascertain safe and efficient operations. The position reports to D&W Asset Manager.
The position holder supports clients well planning and reports to the project Asset Drilling Manager.
Experience with Multi-Lateral Wells is viewed as an advantage.
The position holder will demonstrate strong commitment to the HSSE and quality standards within clients and Norwegian rules and regulations.








Work location Stavanger.
Some offshore work can be expected.

Responsibilities
Exhibit a sound knowledge of discipline, the organization’s systems, and provide a satisfactory level of competence in identified behaviors and skills required.
Work independently, provide recommendations on local/regional issues and work/interact with other internal/external departments.
Initiate planning, organizing, and prioritizing.
Provide guidance within area of expertise to less senior staff
Exhibit strong teamwork, communication, attention to details and problem solving skills.
Contribute in ensuring compliance with both regulations and company procedures, and handle non-conformities as required

Join the SURF asset integrity team as an engineer and help our clients make better decisions. With cutting-edge methods and tools, you will monitor SURF assets, analyse data, and develop interactive dashboards on our digital platform.
Our team is working closely with clients, helping them get value from understanding data and providing them with the insight they need to keep operating their assets safely and efficiently.
You will be part of a team of highly experienced engineers who are welcoming and passionate about sharing good ideas and knowledge. Together with you, we will continue to build and create new services that are valuable to our clients and partners.
You typically have a strong background in SURF or have experience with integrity management. You also have a keen interest in being involved with creating new services and products for our clients.

JOB DESCRIPTION
We are seeking a highly skilled Instrument Engineer to join our Maintenance, Modifications and Operations. The ideal candidate will have a professional interest in following developments in technology and improving work methods, as well as strong communication and cooperation skills. They will participate in study groups, concept development work and detail engineering, and will be responsible for specifying and preparing new and updated layouts, termination and loop designs. Additionally, they will specify, prepare data sheets, and follow-up with vendors for instrument packages, prepare job cards, and MTO for bulk and tagged items. Offshore and onshore field surveys will also be required.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Cognite IT is dedicated to finding more sustainable, scalable, simple, and secure solutions, as we are growing rapidly, spreading to the US, Japan, and Asia. , we believe you are highly motivated, proactive, and solution-oriented, with excellent troubleshooting skills. DNV is a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications for the assurance industry with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets.
Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity industry data platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe, and secure way.

Veracity is DNV’s independent cloud, set out to deliver trust and scale to industry digitalization and decarbonization. It brings together all the key players in the maritime and energy industries, to drive business innovation and digital transformation over a common data truth. On Veracity Marketplace, users can further browse, purchase and access relevant industry data, applications, and digital services. Job_title: «Great opportunity in clean energy technology development :
Description:
Automation Engineer
Job Description
The Automation System is the central nerve system in the ZEG plants. Therefore, the Automation Engineer is a key role in the ZEG team, including development and delivery activities. The role constitutes a variety of responsibilities related to the current scale-up, industrialisation and commercialisation phase of the company and its technology. The Automation Engineer reports to the Chief Operations Officer (COO).

Engineering and commissioning related to instrumentation, automation, and safety systems (SAS - PLC/SCADA/HMI), and electrical equipment for the company’s process plants.

Description:
Do you have a passion for 5G and the future of Mobile Data communication? Then this is your opportunity to work with interesting and challenging topics in an international team of specialists and experts as we are now hiring a Mobile Core Network Engineer. My name is Calle Strengell and I am heading our Mobile Packet Core Operations in Denmark, Norway and Sweden.
Is this your next opportunity?
We are on an exciting journey for the future, making significant changes in our networks and services, and the way we operate them. The (r)evolution in Telco networks and services is more present than ever before. Virtualization and containerization are reshaping how we build and operate our Mobile Packet Core. At the same time, 5G and Internet of Things are bringing a wealth of new applications and business opportunities. If you want to be part of this exploration of new technologies and ways of working, our team is where to be.

Job_title: NORDIC AVANADE TRAINEE PROGRAM 2023 – Software Engineering – Avanade Norway
Description:
Nyutdannet Software Engineer 2023

Avanade er en verdensledende leverandr av konsulenttjenester, med nrmere 60.000 ansatte i 26 land. Selskapet eies av Accenture og Microsoft. Vårt fokus er digital transformasjon av de strste virksomhetene, både i Norge og internasjonalt. Felles for oss alle er en ekteflt lidenskap for innovasjon og teknologi, og et genuint nske om å utvikle forretningskritiske lsninger som forbedrer hverdagen til våre kunder. Vårt tette samarbeid med Microsoft og Accenture, og vår globale leveransemodell gjr oss unike i markedet. I lpet av et år leverer vi mer enn 1000 prosjekter globalt, og vi tilbyr våre konsulenter muligheter for karriereutvikling både i Norge og internasjonalt.

Hvorfor velge vårt Nordiske Trainee program? Fordi her får du muligheten til å gjre teori om til praksis etter endt studietid!

I Avanade er forretning og teknologirådgivning ikke bare vår karriere, men vår store lidenskap. Som Trainee hos oss kommer vi til å hjelpe deg med din karrierestart innen teknologi. For oss betyr det mer enn bare å jobbe med ny innovasjon - det betyr å bruke teknologi for å lse forretningsutfordringer på måter som utgjr en reell forskjell for oss, våre kunder, og samfunnet. Hvis du har en genuin interesse for teknologi og lsningsutvikling, kan Avanade tilby deg et 5 måneders langt Trainee program som samkjres på tverrs av de nordiske landene. Du vil ansettes på ordinre vilkår men få mulighet til å kombinere praktisk training og virkelige kundeprosjekter de frste 5 månedene.

Du vil vre omringet av flotte og kunnskapsrike kolleger, og derfor ha muligheten til å bygge og utvide ditt nettverk lokalt, på et nordisk nivå og globalt. Du vil arbeide med hyt kvalifiserte Microsoft-eksperter, bli trent profesjonelt og vre en del av teamet som hjelper våre kunder med å oppnå resultatene i et milj der folk blir inspirert til å vre sitt beste.

Du vil ta kurs, bli introdusert til vår virksomhet og våre prosesser. Du får din egen karriererådgiver som kan hjelpe deg med alt du trenger for å lykkes i Avanade.

En helt vanlig dag på jobb med Software Engineering teamet hos Avanade vil du blant annet jobbe med:
Kjenner du deg igjen i beskrivelsen?


Snart ferdig utdannet og leter etter drmmejobben? Her er din sjanse!

Utgjr en forskjell fra frste dag! I Avanade favner vi bredt, kom som du er. Ta med dine beste egenskaper, kunnskap og vilje til fortsatt utvikling og vi vil investere i din lring, personlige vekst og karriere. Vi i Avanade har fokus på mangfold og inkludering og nsker å ke kvinneandelen i IT-bransjen. Derfor oppfordrer vi kvinner til å ske.

Ble du interessert?

Sk i dag!

Sknader behandles fortlpende.

Description:
Aker BP’s vision is to become the leading exploration and production company within oil and gas. We plan to achieve that by producing natural resources with low emissions and costs, while at the same time creating jobs, along with values for our owners and the broader society. Measured in production, we are one of the largest independent publicly listed oil companies in Europe. We have big plans for the future, which include further growth and a desire to improve the industry.


Drilling & Wells is responsible for delivery of large project portfolio with total net resources of more than 700 million barrels of oil equivalents, and a comprehensive exploration campaign to support future organic growth. You will be reporting to D&W Manager in one of our Assets with the ambition to develop Aker BP to the next level in the driling industry and change the oil and gas industry. You will also have an active role in Aker BP’s improvement and digitalization agenda finding better and smarter ways of working.

Description:
At Moreld Ross Offshore we understand the lifecycle of an oil field – and know exactly what you need, every step of the way. We have been in your shoes.

We live to solve difficult challenges and find the best solutions tailored for you. We help you fill the gaps – and we do it fast. Our workforce is flexible and highly adaptable. Equipped with technology that enables us to deliver quality and work efficiently regardless of location.

We are proud to be competent team players. Our workforce is hard working, highly experienced within oil services AND has guaranteed experience from the NCS. We work together, across fields to ensure your success.
Duration: 01.08.2023 - 01.08.2025


Perform completion technical engineering work in all phases of the well projects in close collaboration with asset, subsurface, projects, contractors and drilling superintendent, in order to ascertain safe and efficient operations. The position reports to D&W Asset Manager.
The position holder supports clients well planning and reports to the project Asset Drilling Manager.
Experience with Multi-Lateral Wells is viewed as an advantage.
The position holder will demonstrate strong commitment to the HSSE and quality standards within clients and Norwegian rules and regulations.








Work location Stavanger.
Some offshore work can be expected.

Why TI?
Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.

About Texas Instruments
As a global semiconductor company, we design, manufacture, test and sell analog and embedded processing chips to nearly 100,000 customers. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable.

Description:

Bulk Data Centers AS er en datasenteroperatør som bygger, utvikler og drifter datasentre i Norge og Norden, og er heleid datterselskap i Bulk Infrastructure Group AS. Med 70 ansatte omsatte konsernet for NOK 366 millioner i 2021. Selskapet har en solid økonomi.

Description:
Join the SURF asset integrity team as an engineer and help our clients make better decisions. With cutting-edge methods and tools, you will monitor SURF assets, analyse data, and develop interactive dashboards on our digital platform.
Our team is working closely with clients, helping them get value from understanding data and providing them with the insight they need to keep operating their assets safely and efficiently.
You will be part of a team of highly experienced engineers who are welcoming and passionate about sharing good ideas and knowledge. Together with you, we will continue to build and create new services that are valuable to our clients and partners.
You typically have a strong background in SURF or have experience with integrity management. You also have a keen interest in being involved with creating new services and products for our clients.

Tampnet is now looking for a Core Network Engineer join the team
Our business is growing, and we are looking for a Core Network Engineer (NE) to join our Mobile Team in Stavanger, Norway. The NE is a member of the Core, Cloud and Software team responsible for management of the LTE/5G core network infrastructure and involved in the long-term strategy for the development of Tampnet's core network services. The management of the LTE /5G core network infrastructure applies to architecture, operations, maintenance, NOC services and improvements projects. The NE reports to the Manager, Core, Cloud and Software.

By joining Tampnet, you will be a part of an exciting Company with an entrepreneurial mindset. You will be part of a group with talented individuals who work together across geographies on common objectives that all culminate in one goal: always to take Tampnet to new levels. We are proud to be the worldwide leading offshore communications provider contributing to making the planet greener while improving people's lives.

Job_title: Integration Engineer - Cloud Solutions to Ericsson in Fornebu Oslo.
Description:
About this opportunity
We are now offering an exciting opportunity to join us as Integration Engineer where your main tasks will be deployment and support activities for Ericsson Cloud Native Infrastructure (CNIS) platform. The Ericsson CNIS platform is the base for running our 5G core containerized Network Functions

Our delivery project activities are, for instance, to integrate new products into customer network, upgrade existing nodes, expand existing nodes, configure existing nodes, and solve issues. This is a great opportunity to learn, contribute and deliver on the latest Cloud Native technology enabling 5G. Your day-to-day activities will include analysis, preparation, design & configuration, verification, troubleshooting, and customer communication.

Description:
Local Unit & Position Description:
DNV is a world-leading provider of digital solutions and software applications for the assurance industry with focus on the energy, maritime and healthcare markets.
Our solutions are used worldwide to manage risk and performance for wind turbines, electric grids, pipelines, processing plants, offshore structures, ships, and more. Supported by our domain knowledge and Veracity industry data platform, we enable companies to digitize and manage business critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe, and secure way.

Veracity is DNV’s independent cloud, set out to deliver trust and scale to industry digitalization and decarbonization. It brings together all the key players in the maritime and energy industries, to drive business innovation and digital transformation over a common data truth. On Veracity Marketplace, users can further browse, purchase and access relevant industry data, applications, and digital services. Today, more than 40 000 companies and 300 000 users engage over Veracity, enjoying frictionless connection through the exchange of datasets, APIs, applications, and insights. Visit www.veracity.com to discover more.
